title: Renormalization of Hamiltonians in the Light-Front Fock Space
abstract: We outline an ultraviolet renormalization procedure for hamiltonians acting in the light-front Fock space. The hamiltonians are defined and calculated using creation and annihilation operators with no limitation of the space of states. Both, the regularization of the initial hamiltonian and the definition of the renormalized effective hamiltonians, preserve the light-front frame kinematical symmetries. The general equations for the effective hamiltonians are illustrated by second order calculations of the self-energy and two-particle interaction terms in Yukawa theory, QED and QCD. Infrared singularities are regulated but not renormalized.
